bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, October 17, 1901
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D. NOV 11 01 DEPT OF STATE.

div1.p: No. 84. Consular. Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, October 17, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State Washington.
Subject. No Free Ports in Liberia.
No. 84. Consular. Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, October 17, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.

Sir: Replying to Departmental circular request of August 27, 1901, to the Consular offices of the United States, requesting them to ascertain the facts and to furnish the Department with a list of all the Free Ports in their respective districts, I have the honor to transmit, herewith, copies of correspondence relative thereto, and to inform you that there is no Free Ports in the Consulor District of Liberia. I have the honor
honor to be your obedient servant; Owen L. W. Smith, Consul General Enclosures as above mentioned.
No. 41B/1901, Miscellaneous. Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, October 11, 1901
Hon. W. V. Gibson, Acting Secretary of State, Monrovia.
Sir: I have the honor to say that by direction of the Department of States, Washington, I ask that you be so kind as to furnish me with a list of all the Free Ports if there be such, in Liberia.
I have the honor to be, Your obedient servant, Owen L. W. Smith, Consul General.
Sir: I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your communication of the 11th inst., asking me to furnish you with a list of all the Free Ports if their be such in Liberia.
In reply I have to inform you that there are no such ports in Liberia.
I have the honor to be Sir, your obedient servant, W. V. Gibson Acting Secretary of State.
Hon. O. L. W. Smith U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General U.S. Legation, Monrovia
